cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SE of Galveston Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast, then curving northeast inland across Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (southeast Texas coast)

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast eastward through Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible but not likely to exceed 3 ft
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 mph, gusts to 50 mph) possible at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the upper Texas coast and Galveston Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain of 3–5 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous seas and rip currents that could disrupt vessel traffic
